item.title: Managing Updates with Update Manager and smpatch
item.description:
Introduction link

As I love Debian and some of my servers are running on Solaris, I had to get in touch with Solaris update solutions. They have a GUI called Solaris Update Manager and the CLI version called smpatch.

As it is on servers, I don’t have a graphical interface and I need to run updates with command lines. That’s what I’ll specifically talk about in this documentation. List of interesting binaries:

item.title: Sending Emails from Command Line
item.description:
Introduction link

There can be great utility in sending emails from the command line. Everyone has their own use case, and I’ll explain how it works.

Mail link

Mail is one of the most commonly used commands for sending emails:

 echo "My text body" | mail -s "My Subject" "xxx@mycompany.com" "mail@mail2.com" "mail@mail3.com"

I think this is clear enough. You can do whatever you want before the “pipe” and then send everything.

item.title: Manipulating Images via Command Line
item.description:
Introduction link

It can be very useful to manipulate images through the command line. For example, to automate tasks.

Installation link

For the following manipulations, we’ll need ImageMagick:

 apt-get install imagemagick

Usage link

Getting Information About an Image link

 identify -format "%wx%h" /path/to/image.jpg
